intro: Keraselma cyparissias, commonly known as the Greek cypress, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Apiaceae. It is characterized by its slender, aromatic stems and small, clustered white flowers that bloom in late spring. The plant produces small, round fruits called schizocarps, which split into two parts when mature. Native to the Mediterranean region, it thrives in well-drained soils and full sun. Its historical use in herbal medicine is noted for its potential medicinal properties.
